artworks.title: La Bibliothèque nationale de France ouvre ses métadonnées bibliographiques
La Bibliothèque nationale de France ouvre ses métadonnées bibliographiques

api.title: API
api.content:
Public Domain Works API

The PD calculator API enables you to calculate the public domain status of a work by relying on the back-end public domain calculators. They rely on the copyright flowcharts developped by IViR, Kennisland and the National Library of Luxembourg, in the context of EuropenaConnect.

The API is located at: /api/pd

To make a query to the api you should provide the following parameters:

  • jurisdiction: the country for which to calculate public domain status. Currently we support: 'austria', 'belgium', 'bulgaria', 'cyprus', 'czech', 'denmark', 'estonia', 'finland', 'france', 'germany', 'greece', 'hungary', 'iceland', 'ireland', 'italy', 'latvia', 'lithuania', 'luxembourg', 'malta', 'netherlands', 'norway', 'poland', 'portugal', 'romania', 'slovakia', 'spain', 'sweden', 'switzerland', 'uk'.
  • work: details of the work to perform the calculation for (in json or rdf format).

The return data will be a dictionary in JSON format with the output from the pdcalc reasoner.

It is also permissible to provide a callback parameter for JSONP support.

Example query

/api/pd?{{example_query}}

PD Status Result

     {       "output": "The PDCalc reasoner output string...",       "work": A JSON string of the input used,       "error: "Error messages from the reasoner"      }
